Module main
Package com.vtuberrush.src.ui

Class Button

java.lang.Object
com.vtuberrush.src.ui.Button
public class Button extends Object
A button is a clickable object that interacts with the mouse listener to run certain functions when hovering and releasing the mouse.
All button objects inherit the same color, border, font, and center text alignment.
Version:
0.0.1-alpha.1
Author:
Gio Carlo Ciudadano

    Defines the vertical size of the button in pixels.

    Defines the vertical position of this button from the top of the window in pixels.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Button​(String text, int x, int y, int width, int height)
    Creates a new button at the location with the passed height, width, and renderable text.
    This constructor is used for creating menu buttons.
    Button​(String text, int x, int y, int width, int height, int id)
    Creates a new button at the location with the passed height, width, and selected tile for editing
    This constructor is used for creating level editor buttons.

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    draw​(Graphics graphics)
    Renders the body, border, and text of the button.
    Rectangle
    getBounds()
    Returns the rectangular bounds of this button, defined as four rectangular coordinates (x, y) from the top and left of the window in pixels.
    Called when detecting whether the position of the mouse is within the button.
    int
    getId()
    Returns the unique identifier for this button, used as the index in the buttons [Button] array list.
    boolean
    isMouseOver()
    Returns true if the button is being hovered.

    Returns true if the button is being pressed.

    Resets the state of all buttons.

    Updates the hovered state of this button.
    void

    Updates the pressed state of this button.

  • Constructor Details

    • Button

      public Button​(String text, int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Creates a new button at the location with the passed height, width, and renderable text.
      This constructor is used for creating menu buttons.
      Parameters:
      text - - The text being rendered.
      x - - The horizontal position of the button from the left of the window in pixels.
      y - - The vertical position of the button from the top of the window in pixels.
      width - - The horizontal size of the button in pixels.
      height - - The vertical size of the button in pixels.

    • Button

      public Button​(String text, int x, int y, int width, int height, int id)
      Creates a new button at the location with the passed height, width, and selected tile for editing
      This constructor is used for creating level editor buttons.
      Parameters:
      text - - The text being rendered.
      x - - The horizontal position of the button from the left of the window in pixels.
      y - - The vertical position of the button from the top of the window in pixels.
      width - - The vertical size of the button.
      height - - The horizontal size of the button.
      id - - The ID of the tile being selected for placing in the level editor.

  • Method Details

    • draw

      public void draw​(Graphics graphics)
      Renders the body, border, and text of the button.
      Parameters:
      graphics - - Responsible for drawing objects to the screen.

    • resetButtons

      public void resetButtons()
      Resets the state of all buttons. Called when a button is clicked.

    • isMouseOver

      public boolean isMouseOver()
      Returns true if the button is being hovered.
      Returns:
      mouseOver

    • isMousePressed

      public boolean isMousePressed()
      Returns true if the button is being pressed.
      Returns:
      mousePressed

    • setMousePressed

      public void setMousePressed​(boolean mousePressed)
      Updates the pressed state of this button.
      Called when the mouse is being clicked and is within bounds of this button.
      Parameters:
      mousePressed - - The state of the button being updated.

    • setMouseOver

      public void setMouseOver​(boolean mouseOver)
      Updates the hovered state of this button.
      Called when the position of the mouse is within bounds of this button.
      Parameters:
      mouseOver - - The state of the button being updated.

    • setText

      public void setText​(String text)
      Updates the text of this button.
      Called when pausing and unpausing the game.
      Parameters:
      text - - The text being updated.

    • getBounds

      public Rectangle getBounds()
      Returns the rectangular bounds of this button, defined as four rectangular coordinates (x, y) from the top and left of the window in pixels.
      Called when detecting whether the position of the mouse is within the button.
      Returns:
      bounds

    • getId

      public int getId()
      Returns the unique identifier for this button, used as the index in the buttons [Button] array list.
      Returns:
      id
